item.title: Water chiefs' bonuses could be blocked for sewage spills
item.description: Rule breaches such as sewage spills should cost bosses their bonuses, the environment secretary says.

item.title: Marathon world record holder dies in Kenya crash
item.description: Kelvin Kiptum, 24, was killed alongside his coach in a car travelling in western Kenya.

item.title: Nato chief says Donald Trump comments 'undermine all of our security'
item.description: The presidential hopeful suggests the US will not protect allies failing to meet defence spending targets.

item.title: Rwanda plan flawed at core, says cross-party report
item.description: A key parliamentary committee says the asylum plan is incompatible with UK human rights safeguards.

item.title: Rochdale: Four boys aged 12-14 arrested on suspicion of rape
item.description: The boys, aged 12, 13, 14, and 14, remain in police custody in Rochdale.

item.title: Biden says Israel needs civilian safety plan in Rafah
item.description: The US President tells Israel's PM that the measure is needed before its planned offensive there.

item.title: HMS Prince of Wales fails to depart for Nato exercises
item.description: HMS Prince of Wales was due to replace HMS Queen Elizabeth which broke down just before departure.

item.title: Schools in budget crisis as PFI charges soar
item.description: Inflation sends Private Finance Initiative contracts spiralling, cutting into classroom spending

item.title: Maestro: How Carey Mulligan turned supportive wife into leading lady
item.description: The Oscar-nominated actress discusses female roles and being a fan of writer Jesse Armstrong.

item.title: Horizon scandal: Five short-changed postmasters to get full compensation
item.description: A u-turn means Teju Adedayo and four others can now claim full Horizon scandal compensation.

item.title: Labour candidate Azhar Ali apologises for Israel comments
item.description: Rochdale by-election candidate Azhar Ali says his claims about the 7 October attack were "ignorant".

item.title: Farnham penguin finds 'guide bird' in one of her friends
item.description: Partially-sighted Squid the penguin, who developed cataracts as a chick, now has a guide to help.

item.title: The Papers: Shapps' war on 'woke' Army and King's wave of hope
item.description: Monday's papers feature the defence secretary's concerns for Army culture and King Charles III's first outing in a week.

item.title: Nicole Scherzinger and Sunset Boulevard lead winners at WhatsOnStage Awards
item.description: A monochrome and minimalist production of Sunset Boulevard shines at the theatre awards ceremony.

item.title: Wegovy, the 'Viagra' of weight-loss drugs flying off the shelves
item.description: How did Danish weight-loss treatment Wegovy become a global sales sensation?

item.title: Crime to buses: Wellingborough by-election in charts
item.description: What does data show us about some of the issues facing voters in the constituency?

item.title: Trump on Nato: Dangerous talk at a dangerous time
item.description: The US presidential hopeful's remarks left military chiefs aghast but will delight supporters.

item.title: Death and Israel’s search for ‘total victory’ in Gaza
item.description: Jeremy Bowen looks at Gaza's humanitarian crisis and a growing panic in Rafah over a looming Israeli offensive.

item.title: We couldn't afford to bury our baby, says former miner
item.description: A former miner recalls a painful choice he had to make during the 1984-85 miners' strike.

item.title: Afcon 2023: Nigeria 1-2 Ivory Coast - Haller wins final for Elephants
item.description: Sebastien Haller is the hero again as Ivory Coast come from behind to beat Nigeria and win the 2023 Africa Cup of Nations final.

item.title: Man and woman charged after boy bitten by XL bully in Bootle
item.description: The eight-year-old is in a serious condition in hospital after being bitten on the head by the dog.

item.title: Clare Rewcastle Brown: UK journalist says Malaysia sentence is 'political revenge'
item.description: Clare Rewcastle Brown claims her defamation conviction is linked to her work on the 1MDB corruption scandal.

item.title: King Charles in first public outing since cancer diagnosis revealed
item.description: King Charles waved to members of the public as he attended church in Norfolk with Queen Camilla.

item.title: Ralph Fiennes: West End theatre prices 'worryingly high'
item.description: Fleabag star Andrew Scott also aired concerns around an affordability "problem" in the industry.

item.title: The student planespotter angering the private jet-set
item.description: Jack Sweeney's social media accounts track private planes. Some celebrity owners do not like it.

item.title: No-fault eviction ban by next election, Michael Gove promises
item.description: The housing secretary says courts will be given funding to enforce a ban by the next general election.

item.title: Cillian Murphy: I'd be an eejit not to enjoy Oscars
item.description: Star tells Desert Island Discs he has struggled with spotlight, but will aim to enjoy Academy Awards.

item.title: West Ham United 0-6 Arsenal: Gunners romp to emphatic win to close gap on leaders
item.description: Arsenal secure their biggest Premier League away win with a ruthless dismantling of West Ham to move back to within two points of leaders Liverpool.

item.title: Brianna Ghey: Vigil marks one year since teen's murder
item.description: The mother of the murdered teenager describes her as "unique and joyful" to the crowds who attended.

item.title: The Body Shop set to appoint administrators in UK
item.description: The retailer is expected to undergo a major restructure, leading to shop closures and job losses.

item.title: Lego super fan designs dream red phone box kit
item.description: John Cramp, 43, is living his childhood dream after beating thousands of entrants with his idea.

item.title: Your pictures on the theme of 'towers'
item.description: A selection of striking images from our readers around the world.

item.title: Sinéad O'Connor nominated for Rock & Roll Hall of Fame
item.description: Other nominees include Mariah Carey, Oasis, Ozzy Osborne and Cher, who has previously vowed not to accept.

item.title: Bad economy, nosy relatives: Young Chinese put off by Lunar New Year
item.description: China's sluggish economy is one reason why some have decided not to go home for the holiday.

item.title: Aston Villa 1-2 Man Utd: 'Momentum' with Red Devils as they hunt down top-four rivals
item.description: Manchester United's late win at Villa Park continues their positive momentum as they chase down their rivals for a top-four finish.

item.title: Six Nations 2024: 'Ireland keep back-to-back bid alive but tougher tests await'
item.description: After avoiding a slip-up against Italy, Ireland stay level-headed before more daunting games against Triple Crown rivals Wales, England and Scotland.

item.title: West Ham 0-6 Arsenal: 'Massive' result puts Arsenal 'right in race'
item.description: Arsenal backed up their win against Liverpool with a thrashing of West Ham that has pundits believing they are "right in the title race".

item.title: Afcon 2023 final: Nigeria 1-2 Ivory Coast - highlights
item.description: Watch highlights as hosts Ivory Coast come from behind to beat Nigeria 2-1 and win the 2023 Africa Cup of Nations.

item.title: Women's FA Cup: Chelsea edge past Crystal Palace as other WSL sides avoid upsets
item.description: British record signing Mayra Ramirez scores her first goal for Chelsea as they narrowly beat Championship side Crystal Palace in the Women's FA Cup.

item.title: Six Nations: James Lowe scores brilliant solo try for Ireland against Italy
item.description: Watch James Lowe's brilliant "one-man effort' as Ireland cruise to a 36-0 win against Italy in the Six Nations.

item.title: Aston Villa 1-2 Man Utd: Why Villa will still make the Premier League's top four - Stephen Warnock
item.description: MOTD2 pundit Stephen Warnock still believes Unai Emery's know-how will help Aston Villa make the Champions League spots despite their drop in form.

item.title: How to get a job: Six expert tips for finding work
item.description: There are 10m people out of work in the UK, so if you're searching for a job you're not alone. Here are some tips on how to get started.

item.title: What is the UK inflation rate and how does it affect me?
item.description: The rate at which prices are rising has dropped from record highs, but still remains above the 2% target.

item.title: What are UK interest rates and when will they fall?
item.description: Bank of England interest rates affect the mortgage, loan and savings rates for millions of people.

item.title: Cost of living payment: When is it and who gets it?
item.description: Millions of low-income households will receive a final cost of living payment soon.

item.title: State pension and triple lock: What is it worth and when do you get it?
item.description: The state pension will rise by 8.5% in April following a pledge to protect the value of the benefit.
